result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Erik T Christopherson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Erik T Christopherson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1569  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Def not to be in any bars, taverns or liquor stores. Def not to have any alcohol in the home.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.

Def to have the sobrietor for first 6 mo after release.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes:
With huber. Credit does NOT apply.   Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.
2/25/16 Crt orders that the def's sentence is stayed from Feb 22, 2016 at 7 am until August 22, 2016. The Def shall report to the DCJ no later than 7 am on Mon, August 22,2016.
8/19/16 Crt orders the def's sentence stayed from 8/22/16 at 7 am until 1/22/17 at 7 am.

All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Motion hearing on February 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.

filed by Dane County Sheriff's Office (DCSO) for Revocation of Huber Privileges; Ct denied motion at 2-14-17 hearing

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
Defendant in court with Attorney David Andrew Bolles.  William Leroy Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin; Arguments heard; Atty Bolles petition includes a request for reinstatement of Huber, but defn never had a Huber revocation hearing after he over-dosed and was discharged from the hospital; defn lost his GOOD TIME before the stay of sentence was imposed; parties from jail diversion and jail medical were on hand to answer any questions of the court; Ct orders that the stay of sentence is as of 1-22-17 and defn must report to jail to finish his sentence; the court is taking no action on defn's good time and will let the jail do their huber revocation hearing and submit the request to the court as usual if they ultimately decide to motion to revoke Huber; Ct denied Atty Bolles' request for more time for stay of sentence
Hearing on January 12, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
